question.title: What is the characteristic feature of acute eczema?
question.description: Describe the typical presentation of acute eczema in children and adults.

option_a.title: Purulent discharge
option_a.description: A thick, yellowish discharge is often present on the surface of the lesions.

option_b.title: Well-defined borders
option_b.description: Acute eczema lesions typically have poorly limited erythema and vesicles.

option_c.title: Itching and crusting
option_c.description: Acute eczema is often characterized by intense itching and crusting of the lesions.

option_d.title: Limited to the area of allergen application
option_d.description: Allergic contact eczema typically presents with lesions limited to the area where the allergen was applied.

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct answer is a brief letter (A, B, C, or D) indicating the correct option.
